loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José de 63 años, es taxista tiene dos hijos y viven en una zona urbana llamada “Suburbio” caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Cuando se jubilo tubo que comprar un taxi para poder solventar los gastos de su familia. Su trabajo lo realiza recorriendo todas las calles de Guayaquil, trabaja en horarios fáciles desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00am para poder dedicarle tiempo a su familia. El quiere seguir trabajando para así solventar económicamente a su familia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques y pinturas para hacer un departamento en su casa para alquilarlo y así cuando se enferme tener dinero adicional. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
José, 63, is a taxi driver. He has two children and they live in an urban zone called “Suburbio” which is notable because most of its residents are informal merchants. When he retired he had to buy a taxi in order to meet family expenses. His job consists in traveling throughout all of Guayaquil’s streets. He works easy schedules from 7am until 6pm so that he can spend time with his family. He wants to continue working in order to meet his family’s economic needs. He wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, concrete blocks and paint to build an apartment in his house to rent out so that he can have additional income if he were to become ill. In the future he’d like to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement, paint and concrete blocks.

loans.name: James Kamau

texts.en:
James Kamau has been rearing chickens for six years in Riabai, one of the rural areas a few kilometers from Kiambu.  He sells the chickens to brokers who take them to Nairobi town centre, and he earns an income of Kshs. 15,000 per month. The other source of income for his family is through a transport business which is his secondary business.

James was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the KADET clients who happened to be the treasurer of a group that is already with KADET LTD. He is applying for his first loan which he plans to use to purchase more broilers and layers. He plans to save the income he earns to buy another car for his transport business.  

James is 44 years old and married to Hellen Kanyi and they have four children aged 16, 12, seven and five years old. In future, James hopes to grow his business and taxi company. He is very hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase more broilers and layers

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yanira de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y queso, reside en Concepción Batres, Departamento de Usulután donde vive con su esposo y hermanos, la pareja aun no tienen hijos; Yanira se dedica a este negocio que surgió por la necesidad de tener ingresos para cubrir algunas necesidades y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, ella desarrolla esta actividad sola no tiene empleados. Yanira quiere invertir en su negocio y así aumentar su producción de pupusas pero no cuenta con los recursos para realizarla, es por esta situación que Yanira solicita un préstamo que le ayude a impulsar un poco más el negocio, comprando los productos para la preparación de su venta como pollo, queso, chicharrón y quesillo.
Este préstamo solventara los inconvenientes de ella pues contara con lo necesario para aumentar sus ventas y estabilizar su negocio.
Los objetivos de Yanira son aumentar sus ventas, crecer en número de clientes, ofrecer a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica que les permita desarrollarse en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Yanira is 28 years old, and works selling pupusas [traditional stuffed tortillas] and cheese.  She lives in Concepción Batres in the department of Usulután with her husband and siblings.  She and her husband don't yet have children.  

Yanira's business arose from the need to have an income to cover the cost of necessities and help her husband with expenses.  She runs the business herself, and has no employees.  Yanira would like to invest in her business and increase production of pupusas, but she doesn't have the resources to do so.  For this reason, Yanira is asking for a loan that would help her move her business forward by purchasing products she needs to make pupusas, like chicken, cheese, pork, and quesillo [a type of cheese].  

This loan would solve her problems by allowing to her count on having the necessities to increase her sales and establish her business.  Yanira's objectives are to increase her sales, grow her number of customers, and make her family more stable economically which would allow them to grow in better conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make pupusas

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria A. is a single woman who lives in Balirong, Naga City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating food vending, BBQ and bakery businesses. Macaria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Macaria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her current businesses as well as enough capital to a open a new business so she can continue to save up for her family's future security. Macaria A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna M. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Baod, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and fishing businesses. Her husband, Arnulfo M., aged 39, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children aged from two to 19. 

Miraluna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Miraluna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 18,900, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to purchase more piglets to raise so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Miraluna M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn R. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Canbuhin, Brgy. Mambugsay, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: vegetable vending and pig fattening businesses. Her husband, Fernando, aged 44, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children aged from six to 17. Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired to something better for her family. 

With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jocelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,100, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable farm and food for her pigs so she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Jocelyn R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pig food

loans.name: Gregora

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria  tiene 76 años , ella Viuda, vive y trabaja con dos de sus Nietas.
Ella mantiene a su pequeña familia con una  Despensa desde el año 1995,  es cliente de Fundación Paraguaya cuando a un vivía su esposo.
Sus nietas  ademas de la despensa  trabaja los fines de semana vendiendo ropas para damas , caballero y niños, por lo tanto ya que retiran y firman juntos usando  ambos  dividiéndose según los pedidos que tengan y según sus Capacidad de pago. 
Este crédito van a utilizar en la compra de bebidas como cerveza ,gaseosas, Vinos y caña, lácteos, panificados , yerba ,azúcar, café etc. y su nieta ropas de la Nueva Temporada Primavera Verano. 
Su deseo es construir  ampliar  mas  hacia el frente  de la casa.
texts.en:
Greogria, 76, is a widow. She lives and works with two of her granddaughters. She supports her small family with a grocery store she’s had since 1995. She has been a client of Fundación Paraguaya since her husband was still living. Her granddaughters, besides working in the grocery store, also work weekends selling clothing for women, men and children. Therefore, they withdraw and sign together using both and divide it up according to the orders they might have and their ability to pay. The loan will be used to buy beverages like beer, soft drinks, wines and sugar cane, dairy products, baked goods, herbs, sugar, coffee, etc. and her granddaughter will buy clothes for the new spring-summer season. Her wish is to add on to the front of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like: sugar, milk, noodles, rice, baked goods, dairy products, meats and others.

loans.name: Inyangamugayo No 4 Group

texts.fr:
Gérard N., née à Ruhango l’Est du Rwanda, il a 28 ans, il est célibataire, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il habite à Nyamata-Bugesera. 
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé INYANGAMUGAYO,  qui est un groupe dont les membres font le commerce et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Gérard et son groupe travaillent pour se satisfaire financièrement, Gérard  comme tout autre membre du groupe prend  sa part du crédit sollicité pour faire de son commerce. Le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter des articles de leurs activités de commerce. Gérard souhaite stabiliser son économie afin d’acheter sa maison d’habitation et fonder son foyer qui veut dire se marier.
texts.en:
Gérard N. was born in Ruhango, in Eastern Rwanda. He is 28 years old, a bachelor and attended school at the elementary level. He lives in Nyamata-Bugesera. He belongs to the INYANGAMUGAYO solidarity group, which is a group whose members are in business and guarantee each other’s loans. Gérard and his group work to meet their financial needs. Gérard, like all the members of his group, takes part in the loan requested to operate his business. The group has taken out a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy articles for their business activities. Gérard wants to stablize his savings in order to buy a house of his own and get married.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Maura Rosa

texts.es: Maura Rosa Perez M. de 53 años se dedica desde hace más de 8 años a la venta de ropa y accesorios de uso personal como prensadores, medias, pirañas, alfileres, entre muchos otros conocidos popularmente como trucha. Ella anteriormente vendía ambulante y ahora posee su tramo propio donde la venta de truchas se logra con mayor facilidad al igual que la ropa. En su negocio recibe la ayuda de su hija mayor de 26 años quien será posiblemente la hija que quede con el negocio como herencia.
texts.en:
Maura Rosa Perez M. is 53 years old and she has worked for over 8 years selling clothing and accessories for personal use such as pressers, socks, pins, "pirañas" and many other items popularly known as "trucha". She previously sold by street and now has her own section where she sells these items more easily than the clothing. She receives help with her business from her eldest daughter who is 26, who will possibly be the one to inherit the business.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for undergarments and other merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING TWO DOORS FOR  A NEW ROOM ON HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 35 years old. She has three children, ages 2, 4 and 6. Her husband has a shop in which he sells different items such as sugar, beans, etc.
 
Marie Grace has a hair salon and she is requesting a loan to buy more hair products that are used in a salon. She also plans to buy more products from the profit she hopes to make and her dream is to have a very big salon in order to make more profits.

loans.use: Buying salon products

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 29 years old. She is married to a driver and they are blessed with four children; the oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 6. 

Delphine sells food such as sweet potatoes, beans, cassava, yams and onions. She has been doing this business for six years and she wants to expand her business by opening up a wholesale beans shop. 

She is able to send all her children to school and she will be using the profit of her business to pay the school fees of her children. Her desire is to have her business building in a good business location. Delphine is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuff such as beans.

loans.use: Buying  foodstuffs

loans.name: C1241 Abakundumurimo Group

texts.en:
Leopold is 49 years old and is married with seven children who are between 6 and 25 years old. He is the leader of this group called Abakundumurimo which is well-known in the business of selling drinks made from sorghum. Leopold and his team have been in this business for about one year.

Leopold and his team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of sorghum. This will enable them to start wholesaling to the retailers in their business area and, in addition to that, increase the quantity of drinks for sale.

If successful, they will keep reinvesting in their business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum to wholesale and to use for making more drinks

loans.name: Lorena Rocio

texts.es:
Lorena es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras). Vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Cuando su esposo viajo a Venezuela para darle una mejor vida a ella y a su hija se encontró que no tenia oportunidades, entonces ella para tener dinero para su hija tubo que incurrir a distintos trabajos y uno de ellos fue ser vendedora de productos Yambal. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas y desodorantes para tener mas variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir la casa.
texts.en:
Lorena sells Yanbal products. (Yanbal is a cosmetics company that sells products at low prices to enterprising women). She lives in a hilly periurban zone called “Paraíso” noted for its unpaved streets. When her husband went to Venezuela in an effort to provide her and her daughter a better life he discovered that there were no opportunities there so she had to find ways to earn income for her daughter so she went into various kinds of jobs one of which was a Yanbal saleswoman. She currently works every day starting at 9am. She will use the loan to buy perfumes, creams and deodorants to have a wider variety of products. In the future she’d like to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For perfumes and creams.

loans.name: C1196 Tuvemubukene Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and is married. She is the leader of this group called Tuvemubukene that is well-known in the business of selling a variety of goods such as sorghum, beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Jacqueline and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase some additional goods such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc., to the extent that they can even start wholesaling to the retailers in their area.

If successful, they will keep reinvesting for better financial stability and continue providing the basic needs of their families.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar es empleado y reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel donde vive junto a su esposa, él tiene 28 años de edad y trabaja en una empresa de mensajería desde hace 6 años como asistente de oficina, este es el único ingreso con el que cuenta su familia.
Oscar necesita mejorar su vivienda pero no cuenta con el dinero para realizarlo, por esta situación el se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a mejorar las condiciones en la que se encuentra su vivienda, el desea mejorar y ampliar una parte de su casa para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Sus proyecciones son reparar su vivienda y que está este en buenas condiciones, seguir trabajando para dar a su familia lo necesario y poder pagar este préstamo sin atrasos.
texts.en:
Oscar lives and works in El Transito, within the San Miguel department, along with his wife.  He is 28 years old and has been working as an office assistant for a messaging company for six years.  This is his family's only income.

Oscar needs to improve his home but doesn't have the money with which to do it, so he's seen fit to request a loan so that he can improve the living conditions of his home.  He wants to expand part of his house so that his family will be more comfortable.

He will repair his house so that it will be in better shape, continue to work so that he can provide for his family's needs, and to be able to repay this loan without falling behind.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Los Tres Pino Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Tres Pinos lo conforman Margarita del Carmen B. de 47 años, María del Carmen V. B. de 32 años y Pedro José E. de 40 años, 3 personas esforzadas y trabajadoras que comparten su solidaridad entre sí. Margarita, quien es la coordinadora del grupo se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura en especial maíz, frijol y yuca; María, se dedica igual a la agricultura pero en especial a la compra y venta de cosechas; finalmente Pedro, vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 4 años a sus familiares, vecinos, conocidos y personas que le han sido recomendada por quienes son sus buenos clientes.
texts.en:
The “Los Tres Pinos” (The Three Pine Trees) communal bank’s members are: Margarita del Carmen B., 47, María del Carmen V. B., 32, and Pedro José Enríquez, 40, three hard working, determined people who are mutually supportive. Margarita, who is the group coordinator, has been a farmer for the last 10 years especially of corn, beans and manioc. María is also a farmer but focuses on buying and selling crops. Finally, Pedro has sold clothing and cosmetics for the last 4 years to his friends, neighbors, acquaintances and people who have been recommended to him by his good customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be used in corn, bean and manioc crops.

loans.name: Katty Ruth

texts.es:
Katy es socia del Banco Comunal Aleli.
Katy es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, Katy se dedica a la elaboración de dulces, empanadas, alfajores, productos que son horneados en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en las instituciones. Además Katy se dedica a la preparación de comida para diferentes eventos y compromisos.
Katy necesita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de harina, mantequilla y huevo.
Los sueños de Katy son tener un horno y tener una tienda de repostería.
texts.en:
Katy is a member of the Alelí (Frangipani) communal bank. She has a life partner and three children, two of whom are students. Katy makes sweets, turnovers and cookies in a leased oven. She sells her products to various institutions. She also prepares food for different events. She needs a 900 sol loan to buy flour, butter and eggs. Katy’s dreams are to have an oven and a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and eggs.

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en:
Jean Nepo is 24 years old and is married with one child. He is well-known in the business of providing motorcycle transport and this is his fourth successful year in this business.

Although Jean Nepo has been in this business for about four years, his profits are still too low to provide all the basic needs of his family. To solve this problem, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase another motorcycle. This will increase his income and, in addition to that, he will create one more job for one of his community members.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Jumelle Group

texts.fr:
Jumelle est un regroupement  de  5 femmes mariées ,1 célibataire et 1 veuve qui ont  en moyenne 36 ans,  2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU  I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tel la restauration  avec ROKIATOU M. , les boissons non alcoolisées, les ignames, la teinture etc.
 ROKIATOU M. compte acheter avec son  prêt  100kg de riz  +  4 paquets de condiments + 1 chargement de charrette en bois de chauffe pour faire la restauration. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et les villages voisins .
Les plats sont vendus au  grand marché de Sikasso à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Jumelle is a group of five married women, one single woman and one widow; they average 36 years of age and have on average two children each. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their first loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying customer demand. This group of women have a variety of trades, including restauration in the case of Rokiatou M., the sale of non-alcoholic drinks and yams, dyeing etc.

With her loan Rokiatou M. is planning on buying 100kg of rice plus four packets of condiments, as well as a barrow load of firewood for her restauration business. She gets her supplies at the large market and in neighboring villages. Her dishes are sold for cash at Sikasso's large market, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business. Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to better satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments and other items for restauration

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Maribel es soltera, tiene 1 hija que estudia, Maribel tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende ropa, zapatos, actividad que realiza sola todos los días. Además Maribel manda sus productos a la selva ayacuchana para ser vendidas por su hermana.
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Aleli y solicita un crédito de 900 soles para la compra de calzados.
Los sueños de Maribel son tener un spa pues esta estudiando cosmeatria.
texts.en:
Maribel is single and has a daughter who goes to school. She has a store in a rented locale where she sells clothing and shoes every day. She also sends products to her sister in the Ayacucho jungle for her to sell. Maribel is a member of the Alelí (Frangipani) communal bank and is requesting a 900 sol loan to buy shoes. Maribel’s dreams are to have a spa because she is studying cosmetology.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Vilma Olga

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Aleli.
Vilma es soltera y vive con sus padres, Vilma vende animales menores como cuy que compra de las ferias para luego venderlos en los recreos del barrio de Conchopata, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama. Además Vilma estudia Comunicaciones en la Universidad. Vilma tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de vinos por temporada.
Vilma solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de vinos.
Vilma sueña con tener una tienda estable y viajar a la ciudad de Lima a estudiar una maestría.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Alelí (Frangipani) communal bank. She is single and lives with her parents. She sells small farm animals like guinea pigs that she buys at the livestock fairs and then sells in campground areas of Conchopata. Her mother helps her with this activity. In addition, Vilma is studying Communications at the university. She plans to start selling wines by the season. She is asking for a 900 sol loan to buy wine. Vilma dreams with having a stable store and with traveling to Loma to get a Master’s Degree.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wine.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 44 years old. She has three children and her husband is a driver. Her children are ages 8, 10 and 20. Eugine sells used clothes and needs a loan to buy more clothes in order to make more profits. 

In the future, she hopes to sell a variety of second-hand clothes and more sweat suits so that many clients could buy different clothes from her. She wishes to make enough savings for her children and take them to good schools.

loans.use: Buying used clothes

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, Marivel vende ropa a pedido que compra de la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas en mayor proporción son al crédito. Además Maribel vende vinos de Ica que ofrece a sus amigos de trabajo, Marivel trabaja en la municipalidad.
Marivel es socia del Banco Comunal Aleli y solicita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vinos.
Los sueños de Marivel son tener una tienda de vinos y sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Marivel has a live-in partner and three school aged children. She sells clothes on order that she gets in Lima. Most of her sales are on credit. In addition, Marivel sells wines from Ica to her coworkers. Marivel is a city employee. Marivel is a member of the Alelí (Frangipani) communal bank and is requesting a 900 sol loan to buy wine. Marivel’s dreams are to have a wine shop and that her children stay in school.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wine.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 36 years old and is married with two children who are 2 and 3 years old.

Vincent is well-known in the business of raising cows in order to produce milk for sale. He has been in this business for about two years.

Vincent wishes to become a great farmer dealing in the business of selling cows and, to this end, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. He really hopes that once he raises more cows, he will increase increase his milk production by many liters.

With this increased quantity of milk for sale, Vincent will earn more profits and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for his dairy

loans.name: Liliana Maribel

texts.es:
Liliana de 22 años, vive en una zona del suburbio de Guayaquil es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras). 

Para tener ingresos suficientes y mantener a sus hijos ella comenzó como vendedora Yambal ya que es una empresa que le a permitido pasar tiempo con sus hijos porque las ventas son a sus vecinos y amigos. Ella deja los productos a crédito para que las personas puedan pagar en partes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y pinturas para remodelar su casa ya que necesita el cambio para sus dos hijos. En el futuro quiere ser líder de ventas Yambal y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Liliana, 22, lives in the “El Suburbio” area of Guayaquil. She sells Yanbal products. (Yanbal is a cosmetics firm that sells products at low cost to enterprising women). In order to have sufficient funds to support her children she started to sell Yanbal since it’s a firm that has allowed her to spend time with her children because the sales are to her neighbors and friends. She leaves the products on credit so that the people can repay in installments. She will use the loan to buy cement and paint to remodel her house because she needs a change for her two children. In the future she’d like to be a Yanbal team leader and finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and paint.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married. She is 35 year old with four children whose ages range between 4 and 12 years. They all go to school. Her husband is a driver. 

Mary sells maize and it's now been three years since she started her business. Mary will buy more maize for sale with the loan she hopes to get. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children. In the future, she wants to have a lorry (truck) to transport maize from the villages to her workplace.

loans.use: Buying maize for sale

loans.name: Las Soñadoras Group

texts.es:
La señora Elda Cerón U., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, está felizmente casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando (José Alfredo de once años, Martin de nueve años) y que ambos quieren ser maestros de primaria en educación física.

     Ella se dedica a su negocio de abarrotes, el cual comenzó hace ocho meses para que con eso pueda obtener ingresos dentro de su hogar y salgan adelante, aun así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo don  Martin Alfredo quien trabaja de taxista y así juntos aporten con los gastos de sus hijos.

     Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad es su familia ya que ella también quiere apoyar con los gastos y así saca provecho de su tiempo y obtiene dinero para pagar sus estudios de la universidad (pues ella está estudiando la universidad) y no tenga que depender de nadie más.

       Con las ganancias que obtiene de su tienda de abarrotes lo invierte comprando más mercancía para su negocio  y así su clientela en cuentra lo que busque y se sienta satisfecha  con la compra que realizan.

         Su sueño  de Elda es ahorrar para agrandar más su negocio, para que logre darles lo mejor a hijos y ella también pueda terminar su carrera que es lo que más ha deseado desde que era muy joven y lo quiere realiza para tener un mejor trabajo.

       Se integro al grupo "Las soñadoras" ya que su vecina la señora Rosario la invito a que participara en el préstamo ya que ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes y así puede trabajarlo. Ellas decidieron ponerle ´ste nombre al grupo por que tienen el sueño de lograr lo que se están proponiendo.

El grupo se llama las soñadoras  y se integra de seis  señoras.

  María Ofelia A. M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos por reja para venderlo asado y aliñado (destazado).
  Martha Álvarez M.: invierte el préstamo para  la compra de ingredientes en la elaboración de comidas como son: carnes y verduras.
  Rosario del Carmen Martínez cerón: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales para su estética como son, tintes, tratamientos de capilar, y decolorantes.
  Olga Marín C.: invierte el préstamo para la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
  Glafira Benavente Hernández: utiliza en préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, como son: harina, huevo, queso, aceite entre otros.
  Elda cerón U.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes como son: frijol, aceite, pastas, atún, sardina entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elda Cerón U. lives in Tecpata, Chiapas, México. She is happily married and has two sons that are studying (José Alfredo, 11, and Martin, 9). Both want to be elementary school P.E. teachers. She has a grocery store that she started 8 months ago to earn family income to help them get ahead. Her husband, Martin Alfredo, works as a taxi driver and together they share family expenses. What motivated her to start this business is that she too wanted to contribute to her family’s support and use her time well. She earns funds to pay university costs because she is studying in the university and she doesn’t want to depend on anyone else. She uses profits from her store to buy more merchandise so that her customers can find everything they are looking for and will feel satisfied with the purchases they make. Elda’s dream is to save so that she can expand her store still more in order to give the best to her children and be able to finish her career which is what she’s most wanted since she was very young and she wants to accomplish to have a better job. She joined the “Las Soñadoras” (The Dreamers) group when her neighbor, Rosario, invited her to participate in the loan since she has a grocery store and can manage it. They decided on this group name because their dream is to reach the goal they have set for themselves. The group is called “Las Soñadoras” and it has six members: María Ofelia A. M., who will use the loan to buy crates of chickens to sell both roasted and butchered. Martha Álvarez M., who will use the loan to buy ingredients, like meats and vegetables, for meal preparation. Rosario del Carmen Martínez Cerón, who will use the loan to buy beauty supplies like: dyes, hair treatments and bleaches. Olga Marín C., who will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store. Glafira Benavente Hernández, who will use the loan to buy ingredients to bake bread like, flour, eggs, cheese, cooking oil, etc. Elda Cerón U., who will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store like, beans, cooking oil, noodles, tuna, sardines, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her grocery store like: sugar, beans, cooking oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Yeanor

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Yeanor Sesay. She is married and has two children, aged 26 and 20 years. She has five additional dependents who live with her because they are her husband's relatives and need assistance for their schooling.   

In 1990, Yeanor Sesay established a business selling school bags, Coleman(Coolers), toys and suitcases. She began her business because of her desire to assist her husband in providing a livelihood for their family.  Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,668,600SLL every month from this business. 

She needs a loan of 4,000,000SLL. Yeanor Sesay requires a loan in order to buy more suitcases, school bags and toys for her stall. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 373,604SLL. In the future, Yeanor Sesay plans to build a permanent business structure. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more toys, suitcases, coolers and school bags

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SORO YIRIWA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans  et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat vente de fruits et légumes, de pagnes wax   avec Mariam S. et divers autres articles pour femmes .
 MARIAM S. compte acheter avec son  prêt 50 pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako  et effectue sa vente au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille, en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
These four married women are members of the Soro Yiriwa group and are on average 43 years old with 4 children. The are mostly from monogamous families and live in Medine, one of the neighbourhoods of Sikasso. (Third administrative region of Mali). This will be their seventh business loan with the Soro Yiriwasso microfinance institution.

This group of women buy and sell fruits and vegetables, pagnes wax (wax dyed decorative cloth) and various other women's articles. Mariam S. plans to buy 50 pieces of pagnes wax. She buys supplies from the major market in Bamako and sells her products in the large market is Sikasso in both bulk or as individual items, for cash or credit to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She plans to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 Francs CFA and a part will be used to help support her husband meet the daily expenses and part to be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies of pagnes wax (wax dyed decorative cloth) for resale

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia del Carmen C. mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Esta señora de 39 años por la situación económica y en busca de salir adelante inicio su propio negocio que consiste en la elaboración de tortillas, bastimento por excelencia.
 Ella trabaja junto con su hermana  e invertirá el crédito en materia prima y en la reparación del taller el cual desea ampliar.
texts.en:
Patricia del Carmen C. is a hardworking and enterprising woman who puts effort into her work. She is 39 years old and due to the economic situation and her search to get ahead, she started her own business making tortillas, a staple food.

She works together with her sister and she will invest the loan in raw materials and in the repair of the workshop that she wants to expand.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For corn, firewood and lime to make tortillas

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir nace hace dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es del Barrio San Luis, en estos dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Han pasado por una prueba muy difícil en el ciclo anterior ya que dos de las compañeras incumplieron en los compromisos de pago semanal, cancelaron el crédito y asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente y con éxito el comité al cual pertenecen. 
Actualmente la presidenta del comite es la señora Benicia, quien se dedica  a la confeccion de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños.
Ella tiene su taller de costura en su casa y coonstatemente es visitada por sus clientes quienes le solicitan sus servicion, y ella confecciona las prendas de acuerdo a los modelos que solicitan sus clientes.
Esta actividad para ella es muy importante ya obtiene buen ingreso para su familia, pero nos comentó que es muy sacrificado ya que trabaja mucho por su vista por que actualmente ya debe utilizar anteojos para todas las cosas.
Pero desea seguir trabajando en su profesion para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de accesorios para la confecciones ya que  ella ofrece telas de calidad a sus clientes, ademas debe comprar otros como, cierres, botones, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Porvenir” (The Future) committee was born two years ago thanks to the intervention and support of another committee active in the same area. The committee is in the San Luis neighborhood and during these two years of intense work has grown both socially and economically. They are well known in the area for being very hard working women. They went through a very difficult test last cycle because two of the members were unable to meet their weekly payments. Their loan responsibilities were taken over by the group and they committed to raise up the group they belong to successfully once again. The current group President is Benicia who manufactures clothing for women, men and children. She has her workshop in her home and is constantly sought out by customers who need service. She makes items of clothing according to the styles the customers request. This activity is very important for her because she earns good family income. However, she comments that it is very hard work and damaging to her eyesight; she already has to wear eyeglasses for everything. She wants to continue working in her profession, however, to continue to help her family. She is asking for the loan to buy sewing supplies for her items since she offers quality fabrics to her customers. She also has to buy other supplies like zippers, buttons and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies like fabric, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Katiuska Giomar

texts.es:
Katiuska de 31 años, ella tiene en su casa una pequeña dulcería. Vive en una zona suburbana en Guayaquil con sus cuatro hijos y su esposo. 

Para generar dinero y hacer una actividad que a ella le guste inicio con la venta de dulces y bocaditos que ella mismo elabora, para que la conozcan ella fue a dar una charla en el Municipio de Guayaquil para que la gente pruebe los dulces. Por esa buena decisión ella tubo suficiente clientela para continuar con su negocio y elaborar dulces y bocaditos de todo tipo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar confites, galletas y harina para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su propia casa y su negocio en un buen local.
texts.en:
Katiuska is 31, and has a small sweetshop in her house. She lives in a suburb of Guayaquil, with her 4 children and her husband. To make money and do something she enjoys, she started selling the sweets and snacks that she makes. So that people would know about her, she went to give a talk in the City of Guayaquil and gave people the chance to try her sweets. Because of this good decision, she has plenty of customers to maintain her business and can keep making sweets and snacks of all kinds. With the loan she wants to buy candies, biscuits and flour for her business. In the future she would like to have her own home and business in a good location.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candy, flour, cookies

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia J. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora dueña de una pulpería. Ella en sus inicios tenía una comideria en el populoso mercado oriental pero como se quedo solo con su marido decidió poner un negocio en el hogar es asi que inicia con una pequeña pulpería.

Ella cuenta con el apoyo de una nuera quien le ayuda y con el préstamo piensa mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia J. is a hard-working, determined and enterprising woman, and is the owner of a grocery store. She started off with an eatery in the busy eastern market, but as it was just her and her husband there, she decided to open a business in their home - which was how she started her little grocery store. She counts on the support of the daughter-in-law who helps her. With the loan she plans to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cereals, meat, dairy products

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA (4 femmes mariées  et 2 veuves) avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans,  3 enfants, vivent dans des  familles polygames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts antérieurs se  sont  bien dénoués. Ce groupe de femmes fait  des activités  diverses et variées telles que la  restauration avec MARIAM K., la vente de condiments, la teinture, la vente de savon etc.
MARIAM K.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  200kg de riz +  6 paquets de condiments + 1 chargement de charrette en bois de chauffe pour faire la restauration.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et  dans les villages voisins .
Les plats sont vendus au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Dembagnouma group (four married women and two widows), average 42 years of age and have on average three children each. They live in polygamous families in Medine, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their fourth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying customer demand. All their previous loans have been repaid in full. This group of women have a variety of activities, such as restauration in the case of Mariam K., the sale of condiments, dyeing, the sale of soaps and so on. 

With her loan Mariam K. is planning on buying 200kg of rice, six packets of condiments and one barrowload of firewood for her restauration business. She gets her supplies at the large market and in neighboring villages. Her dishes are sold for cash, at Sikasso's large market and  within her family to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 70,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband out with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restauration

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Maria  se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. yogurt, su esposo trabaja como empleado en un empresa, ellos viven en casa propia ubicada en la zona D. El Recreo del Plan 3000, tienen 5 hijos que asisten a primaria y para poder sustentar su hogar es que la señora Maria se dedica a la venta D. yogurt que ella misma elabora todos los dias y que distribuye en el barrio D. el Recreo, en especial a las tiendas que ya conocen sus productos, ella muy temprano sale a comprar la leche en las lecherias que estan cerca D. su casa, luego prepara como todos los dias los 10 o 20 litros D. yogurt para luego distribuirlos, además D. estar atendiendo su negocio en casa aprovecha para atender las necesidades D. su familia, su sueño es poder comprar maquinas para poder preparar su yogurt en grandes cantidades ya que hoy tambien esta envasando el yogurt en bolsitas para venderlo como helado D. yogurt, ahora ellos necesitan el credito para construir una habitacion para poder elaborar alli el yogurt, puesto que ahora necesitan más espacio.  Ella y su esposo son personas responsables que siempre estan dispuestos a trabajar hasta tarD. para cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria devotes her time to making and selling yogurt. Her husband works as an employee in a large company. They live in their own house in an area called "El Recreo del Plan 3000". They have 5 children at primary school. To help sustain her household, Maria sells the yogurt she makes every day and distributes it throughout the Recreo district, through shops that know her products well. She leaves very early in the mornings to buy the milk at the dairies near her home, and makes it into 10 or 20 litres of yogurt each day for later distribution. Because she works from home, she makes the most of this to look after the needs of her family. Her dream is to be able to buy machines to make her yogurt in large quantities. Already she is also packaging the yogurt in little bags for sale as frozen yogurt / icecream. They now need the finance to build a separate room for making the yogurt, as they need more space. She and her husband are responsible people who are always ready to work late to fill all their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an additional room

loans.name: Tanenkasu Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Tanenkasu II” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Mohamed S. who is pictured in the middle. Mohamed was born in Magburaka town. He is 37 years old. Mohamed is married and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman. Three of his children attend primary school and one is in secondary school. Mohamed S. sells boards, bed, chairs, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy boards, bed, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
La  Sra. Asunciona   tiene 36 años y es madre soltera de  3 hijos menores . 
Ella trabajo siempre en el mercado de San Lorenzo con su madre vendiendo frutas y verduras; luego de mucho sacrificio logro independizarse y montar su propio negocio de ventas de ropas usadas y calzados usados.
Tiene un  modesto puesto ubicado en una  vereda en el mercado San Lorenzo . 
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de mercaderías en cantidad como camisas, remeras, pantalones, calzados , entre otros.
Asunciona   desea  comprar un vehículo y transportar en el su mercadería hacia el interior del pais ya que considera que la venta de sus mercaderías por esas zonas aumentarian mucho. .
texts.en:
Asunciona, 36, is a single mother of three minor children. She always used to work with her mother in San Lorenzo's market selling fruits and vegetables. After much sacrifice she managed to become independent and set up her own business selling used clothes and used shoes. She has a modest stand in San Lorenzo's market. The loan will be of help in buying merchandise like shirts, t-shirts, pants and shoes among others in quantity. Asunciona wants to buy a vehicle to take her merchandise into the interior of the country because she feels that sales of her merchandise in those areas would increase a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts, t-shirts, pants, shoes.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Luz junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en local alquilado en donde brinda servicios de fotocopiado de planos, y hace 4 meses inicio con el revelado de fotos, negocio que esta mejorando.
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza y solicita un crédito de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de monitores para las computadoras, papel y tinta.
Los sueños de Luz son construir su casa de material noble, actualmente es de material rustico y tener una sucursal.
texts.en:
Luz lives with her life partner and their two children who are in school. Luz and her husband have a store in a rented locale where they offer blueprint photocopying services. Four months ago she added photo developing, a business that is improving. Luz is a member of the “Granito de Mostaza” (Little Mustard Seed) communal bank and is asking for a 3000 sol loan to invest in computer monitors, paper and ink. Luz’s dreams are to build her house with substantial materials; it’s currently built with flimsy materials. She’d also like to open a second branch of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer monitors, paper and ink.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 37 años, es madre sola y muy abnegada, vive en casa de su madre, en compañía de sus 2 hijos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado ayudar a su madre, en la atención de su tienda, vendiendo productos comestibles, con el paso del tiempo y ya su madre anciana, ella asumió la responsabilidad de llevar las riendas del negocio. Por lo que trata de abastecerla de diferentes productos, así como bebidas gasificas, que es lo que más  vende a diario. Cuando se va a la capital para comprar al por mayor los productos, su madre es la se encarga de la tienda, ya que no debe descuidar en perder clientes, puesto que tiene mucha competencia cerca de su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de sus ventas son los días sábados; por ser un día que más ventas tiene, además la salida de cerveza es en cantidad que en otros días, dejándole  buenas rentas. Para Mónica es importante continuar con este negocio, además en un futuro lejano quiere poner un pollería o vender comida. Este es su  octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, considerando este crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, con una parte comprará gaseosa y cerveza al por mayor y la otra parte invertirá en el chequeo médico y medicinas para su madre.
texts.en:
Monica is 37 years old and a very self-sacrificing single mother.  She lives in her mother's house with her 2 children.  From her childhood, she has been dedicated to helping her mother, attending to her store and selling food products.  With the passage of time, now that her mother is very old, Monica assumed responsibility and took over the reigns of the business.  That's why she wants to resupply it with different products, especially carbonated beverages, which is what sells best each day.

When Monica goes to the capital to buy products at wholesale, her mother takes charge of the store, since one can't neglect customers without risk of losing them, given the considerable nearby competition.

What Monica likes most about her sales are Saturdays; the day with the most sales, especially sales of beer, which is greater than on other day, resulting in  good profits.  For Monica it is important to continue with this business, and in the distant future she wants to establish a poultry shop, or to sell meals.

This is Monica's 8th loan with MFP and she is committed to being responsible in making her payments.  She considers the loan very useful in the progress of her business.  A part of this loan will be used to buy carbonated drinks and beer at wholesale, and the remainder will pay for a medical check up and medicine for her mother.

loans.use: BUYING MORE PRODUCTS TO SUPPLY HER STORE AND PAYING FOR HER MOTHER'S MEDICAL CARE

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos y 4 estudian, Juana viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego de acopiar vende a la empresa nacional Pronaa.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de haba, quinua y trigo.
Los sueños de Juana son tener un carro para transportar sus productos y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Granito de Mostaza” (Little Mustard Seed) communal bank. She has a live-in partner and six children four of whom are in school. Juana goes to the various regional markets in the area to buy grains that she sells to Pronaa (National Food Assistance Program) after she consolidates them. Juana needs a 2000 sol loan to buy lima beans, quinoa and wheat. Juana’s dreams are to own a car to transport her products and to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lima beans, quinoa and wheat.

loans.name: Huitzililla Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Huitzililla que significa "lugar de los colibríes", esta ubicado en la comunidad de Huitzililla, en el estado de Morelos, México. Esta conformado por 5 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes del grupo son **la señora Cruz P. Sánchez va a comprar con su préstamo cosméticos, labiales, sombras, perfumes etc. para surtir sus pedidos, **la señora Margarita B. G. va a comprar jabón, refrescos, sopas, aceite, azúcar, huevo para surtir su tienda, **la señora Maribel C. Sánchez  va a comprar zapatos de dama, caballero, niños y bebes para surtir sus pedidos, **la señora Luisa V. Sánchez va a comprar verdura, tomate, jitomate, chiles para empezar su negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, **la señora Felipa Sánchez Pérez va a comprar paletas de crema para iniciar su negocio de paletería. Ellas quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias que existen estos programas que ayudan para podamos seguir adelante ya que podemos trabajar en los negocios, nos ayudan a progresar y a vivir mejor.” La señora Margarita B. G. es integrante del grupo Huitzililla tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre su esposo es jornalero trabaja en el campo, ella estudio hasta el 5º. Año de primaria tiene 3 hijos 1 hombre y 2 mujeres santiago tiene 21 años trabaja en Cuautla en una zapatería, Arisbeh tiene 16 años estudia y trabaja en tienda naturista y Lorenza tiene 12 años de edad estudia, la señora Margarita tiene una tienda de abarrotes y vende producto de Jafra por catalogo y solicito su préstamo para comprar jabón, refrescos, dulces, sopas, aceite, azúcar y huevo para surtir su tienda, esta tienda se llama abarrotes peña sus suegros se la heredaron, inicio con el negocio hace 2 años la tenia su suegra pero falleció y se la dejo y ahora ella la atiende, ofrece a sus clientes que son sus vecinos refrescos, dulces, sabritas, gamesa, marinela y productos de Jafra por catalogo. La tienda esta en su casa, le ayuda su hijo Santiago los domingos a atender la tienda. Ella considera importante su negocio por que obtiene beneficios para la familia de ahí se va ayudando en los estudios de sus hijos, le gusta atender a la clientela y se siente orgullosa al tener ingresos para su familia  para alguna emergencia y no andar consiguiendo a ver quien le va a prestar, las ganancia las utiliza para gastos de su casa y para comprar mas mercancía. Ella enfrenta la competencia de 2 tiendas cerca de la suya, sus planes y esperanza son seguir en el negocio, vender más, las mejoras para sus hijos son que sigan estudiando y que estén bien de salud, esto lo piensa lograr echándole ganas a las ventas de sus productos para que crezca el negocio. A la señora Margarita le gusta el pueblo de Huitzililla por que ahí nació y ahí vive, siembran en los campos cebolla es de riego, milpa y sorgo son de temporal.
texts.en:
This group is called Huitzililla which means “place of the hummingbirds” and is located in Huitzililla in the state of Morelos, México. It has five members who are women that know each other and are neighbors. They are: Cruz P. Sánchez who will use the loan to buy cosmetics, lipsticks, eye shadows, perfumes, etc. to fill her pending orders. Margarita B. G., who will buy soap, soft drinks, soups, sugar, cooking oil and eggs to stock her store. Maribel C. Sánchez, who will buy shoes for ladies, men, children and infants to fill her orders. Luisa V. Sánchez, who will buy vegetables like red and green tomatoes and chilies to start her vegetable sales business. Felipa Sánchez Pérez, who will buy cream-based popsicles to start her popsicle business. They would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: “Thanks to the existence of these programs that help us so that we can continue forward and work in our businesses; they help us progress and live better.” Mrs. Margarita B. G. is a member of the Huitzililla group. She is 38 years old, lives in common law union with her husband who is a field day laborer. She finished 5th grade. She has three children, a boy and two girls. Santiago is 21 and works in Cuautla in a shoe store. Arisbeth, 16, is in school and works in a natural products store. Lorenza, 12, is in school. Margarita has a grocery store and also sells Jafra brand catalogue products. She asked for the loan to buy soap, soft drinks, candies, soups, cooking oil, sugar and eggs to stock her store. The store is called “Abarrotes Peña” and it was passed down to her by her in-laws. She started the business two years ago when she still had her mother-in-law. She has since passed away and left the store to her and she tends to it now. She offers her customers, who are her neighbors, beverages, candies, Sabritas (brand of snacks), Gamesa (cracker and cookie brand), Marinela (packaged pastry brand) and Jafra catalogue products. The store is in her home. Her son Santiago helps out on Sundays. She considers her store to be important because it provides benefits for her family; it has helped her provide her children’s education. She enjoys taking care of her customers and feels proud to produce family income for any emergency and not having to seek out someone to get a loan from. She uses profits for household expenses and to buy more merchandise. She faces competition from two other stores near hers. Her plans and hopes are to continue in business and to sell more. Her hopes for her children are that they continue to study and be in good health. She hopes to reach these goals by working hard at sales so that the business grows. Margarita likes the town of Huitzililla because that’s where she was born and where she lives. They plant onions in irrigated fields and corn and sorghum seasonally.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, soft drinks, soups, cooking oil, sugar.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe JIGUIYA sont toutes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce général tel la vente de pagnes, de savons et de riz avec DJINEDIE D., qui compte acheter avec son  prêt  quelques sacs de riz. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché. 
Les riz est revendu au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four women of the Jiguiya group are all married,   averaging 42 years of age and five children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a district in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative district of Mali). They are on their ninth collaboration cycle with the Soro Yirwaso microfinance institution; all previous loans have been duly reimbursed.

The group members sell various merchandise, such as “pagnes” [traditional colorful cloth], soap and rice; Djinedie D., for example, plans to use her loan to purchase several bags of rice. She stocks up at the big market. She resells rice at the big market of Sikasso and out of her home, to a customer based composed of both men and women, retail, for cash. She anticipates  earning an average monthly income of 70,000 West African Francs, which will be used toward everyday family expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing rice

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza
Pelagia es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Pelagia viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego los lleva a la ciudad de Cañete, sus ventas son al por mayor en los mercados. Además en algunas oportunidades vende comida en el mercado Nery García.
Pelagia solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de cebada, papa seca.
Los sueños de Pelagia son tener una tienda, un grifo y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Pelagia is a member of the communal bank "Granito de Mostaza" (Mustard Seed). She is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Pelagia travels to the different markets in the region to buy grains. She then takes them to the city of Cañete where she sells them wholesale in the markets. At times she also sells food in the Nery García market. Pelagia is requesting a loan for 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to buy barley and dried potato. Her dreams are to one day own her own store and a service station and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase barley and dried potato

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos fue cliente anteriormente el trabajo con el grupo solidario "19 de marzo" el cual por motivos internos se disolvió,  después de dos años el retorna para sacar un crédito individual.  El vive en anticrético juntamente con la Sra.  Luisa su esposa la cual trabaja en una pastelería, y el Sr. Carlos se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de pan y sus dos hijos uno de ellos ya es independiente, trabaja en un laboratorios y el otro todavía esta en etapa escolar. Don Carlos en su afán de darles a sus hijos mayor comodidad solicito este crédito para regalarle a su hijo mayor un juego de dormitorio, el Sr. Es muy trabajador y esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos used to be a member of the “19 de Marzo” communal bank which, for internal reasons, disbanded. After two years he has returned to request an individual loan. He lives under the anticrético modality with his wife Luisa who works in a pastry shop (Anticrético: transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you). Carlos is a baker. He hast two sons. One of them is independent and works in a laboratory, the other is still in school. In his effort to provide his children with the most comfort, he has requested this loan in order to give his oldest son a bedroom set. Carlos is very hard working and is very grateful to the institution for the support given by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bedroom set for his son.

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es:
Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito D. Mostaza y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro.
Eudomilia es casada, tiene 66 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 esta a su responsabilidad y estudia en la ciudad D. lima.
Eudomilia junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, productos para helados, vasos D. tecnopor.
Eudomilia solicita un préstamo D. 1700 para la compra D. vasos.
Los sueños D. Eudomilia son que sus hijos salgan adelante y comprar un carro para salir D. vacaciones.
texts.en:
Eudomilia is a member of the Granito D. Mostaza (Mustard Seed) Communal Bank and what she likes best about it is the incentive to save. She is married, 66 years old, and has 7 children, one of whom remains her responsibility and still studies in the city of Lima. Eudomilia, with her husband, operates a store in her home where she sells groceries in general, drinks, frozen products, and tecnopor glasses. She is soliciting a loan of 1,799 new sols to buy more glasses. Eudomilia's dreams are that her children should get ahead, and to buy a car to take on vacations.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING GLASSES TO SELL

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella is 28 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband sells charcoal. The ages of her children are 18 months and 3 years. One  child studies,while the other one has not yet reached school age.

Drocella sells onions, tomatoes and spices.  Her business is well-known locally and she has developed a clientele because of her good customer care. She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more onions, tomatoes and other food products.  Drocella's dream is to start a wholesale store where she would sell onions, spices, charcoal and food.  With the increased profits from her business, Drocella plans to pay school fees for her child with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy food products to expand the business.

loans.name: Pan Sellers Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Pan Sellers” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each of them. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu C. (right) is the leader of this group. The 55-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for 30 years now and she sells dishes (pans), rubber bowls, buckets, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy dishes, rubber bowls, buckets, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: El señor José Armando M. N. vive con sus abuelos ya que se encuentra separado de su conyuge hace tres años aproximadamente, tiene dos hijos a los cuales envía una pensión por mutuo acuerdo. El cliente desempeña labor de chofer de mototaxi solo por medio tiempo por que trabaja adicionamente como vigilante de la Municipalidad de Ica también realiza trabajos de informática en su domicilio de manera temporal. Solicita el crédito para sus gastos personales y tener mejor calidad de vida, se otorgará el crédito por contar con capacidad para asumir una nueva obligación.
texts.en:
Mr. José Armando M. N. lives with his grandparents because he’s been separated from his spouse for about three years now. He has two children for whom he sends a monthly, mutually agreed upon, child support stipend. He works as a mototaxi (motorcycle equipped with an attached cabin to transport passengers and cargo) driver part time because he also is employed as a municipal watchman by the city of Ica and he also does occasional computer work at home. He is asking for the loan for personal expenses and to have a better quality of life. The loan will be granted because he has the capacity to take on a new obligation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Sr.de Torrechayoc - Mototaxistas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC - MOTOTAXISTAS ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana;  ella tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia vive en Urubamba en el barrio tradicional de pintacha, ella se dedica a trabajar en una chichcarronería como ayudante en las labores domésticas y poco a poco ella ahorrado su sueldo con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a esta modalidad de banco ha podido comprar su moto taxi y ponerla al servicio público, ella trabaja alquilando su unidad vehicular y ella administra los ingresos de esta luego de pagar al chofer su parte de ganancias ella tiene su ingreso diario, la socia a futuro comprara otra unidad, pero mientras ella sigue laborando en la chicharronería  y administrando su moto taxi, ella deberá hacerle mantenimiento a su unidad vehicular para dejarla operativa y con combustible para la siguiente jornada de este ciclo y desea el dinero para que no afecte su economía diaria. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento respectivo de su moto taxi y llenar el combustible para que comience una nueva etapa de trabajo.

Los otros socios son  choferes de moto taxis ellos mismos manejan las unidades vehiculares y en el caso de los varones son propietarios de sus motos taxis;  el mínimo grupo vende verduras y La socia Justina se dedica a la venta de ropas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC – MOTOTAXISTAS” communal bank, located in the Urubamba province, in the Cusco department.

Juana is 23 years old and lives with her cohabitant and two children, in the Pintacha neighborhood of Urubamba.  She works in a factory where they make fried pork rinds, helping with domestic chores.  Little by little she was able to save up her salary, and with great effort, and thanks to this [communal] bank, she was able to buy a moto-taxi and put it into service.  She leases out her vehicle and manages the profits that are left, after paying the driver his portion.  This provides her with a daily income.  In the future she will buy another unit, but in the mean time she continues working in the factory and managing her moto-taxi.

She must perform maintenance on her vehicle in order to keep it operating and must also pay for fuel for the next cycle.  She is requesting this loan so that these expenses will not affect her daily income and so that she can begin a new stage of work.

The other members are also moto taxi drivers and they drive the vehicles.  In the case of the gentlemen, they also own their vehicles.  This same group also sells vegetables and Justina sells clothing.

Our associate is grateful and values the loan provided through this means and is committed to making her payments on the established timetable.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Las Americas Group

texts.es:
Banco D. emprendimiento que se encuentra en su 2do. Ciclo conformado por 8 integrantes D. las cuales 6 viven en la misma zona D. la localidad D. Limoncitos. Excepto 2 personas una que vive en la localidad D. Jorochito y la otra en Santa Rita.                                                                                                                                                                                                  La Actividad D. los socios es variada se dedican a la  venta D. cosméticos, venta D. madera, venta D. carne,  maestra, etc.
La  presidenta es la Sra. Andrea  Se dedica a la venta D. carne hace 5 años en su mismo domicilio del b/ villa feliz D. la localidad D. limoncitos, su Estado civil : concubina con el Señor Juan  y cuenta con una hija que se encuentra en edad escolar, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para comprarse un conservador para así poder mantener su carne en buen estado.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              La Secretaria la Sra. Beatriz  vive en la localidad D. Santa Rita se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos en la misma zona (ambulante), su estado civil: concubina con el señor Richard el  cual trabaja en la elaboración D. losetas, en la misma zona D. santa rita y no tienen hijos, con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos al por mayor y también D. catalogo.                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 La Tesorera la Sra. Bella  se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, hace 2 años es concubina con el señor José Luis  y tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar, una familia estable, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar un exhibidor para mostrar sus productos y así poder tener mas ingresos.
Es la segunda secuencia  D. este banco y ellos están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo económico que les brinda.
texts.en:
This communal bank is in their second loan cycle. It is maD. up of 8 members of which 6 live in the same district in the town of Limoncitos and the other 2 live in the towns of Jorochito and Santa Rita. They all do different things for a living including cosmetic sales, wood sales, meat sales, teacher, etc. The president is Señora Andrea. She has been selling meat out of her house in Limoncitos for 5 years. She is in a common law marriage with Señor Juan and has a school-age daughter. She will use the loan to buy a cooler so that she can better store her meat. The secretary is Señora Beatriz. She lives in the town of Santa Rita where she travels selling cosmetic for a living. She is in a common law marriage with Señor Richard who makes tile for a living in Santa Rita. They don't have any children. With the loan she will buy cosmetics wholesale and also by mail-order. The treasurer is Señora Bella. She also sells cosmetics and has been doing this for 2 years. She is in a common law marriage with Señor Luis and they have 2 school-age children and a stable family. With the loan she will buy a display case to show her products so as to increase her income. This is the bank's second cycle and they are very grateful to the institution for the economic support that they proviD. them.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Kabita N.. She is single. In 2006, she established her general store.  By working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to increase her store  inventory. In the future, Kabita plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support.   

In Nepal, large supermarkets are rare. Instead, most items can be found in the small, densely packed pasals that line the streets of every city and village.
