It is located more than two hours and a half from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. For the past four years she has sold candies from a small stand located on one of the main streets of the city. She also sells prepaid cell phone cards and beauty products through a catalogue. She is able to support her children with the help of this business. Cecilia requests a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of more products to supplement her business. With this loan she will increase her merchandise and stimulate an increase in sales. She is a fighter and every day she gives her all, motivated for the love she has for her children. The people that know her consider her to be a very calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candies for her stand.

loans.name: America

texts.es:
América es una madre D. familia D. 61 años D. edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Pueblo Nuevo, una zona rural del distrito D. Buenos Aires, zona agrícola productora D. Cacao y plátanos perteneciente a la provincia D. Morropón, región Piura. Se encuentra ubicada a mas D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace cinco años a la preparación y venta D. platos D. comida en un pequeño resturante – bar instalado en su domicilio. El negocio goza D. muy buena acogida gracias a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas y al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Ella atienD. principalmente a los trabajadores que se quedan a vivir temporalmente en el lugar. Con los ingresos que percibe D. estas actividades ella apoya con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

América desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas insumos D. modo que pueda preparar más platos D. comida y D. esa manera sus ventas y sus ganancias aumenten. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.

América es una mujer responsable y bastante activa, su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio hasta contar con un local propio. Anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
America is a mother, she is 61 years old and she lives together with her family in the village of Pueblo Nuevo, a rural community near Buenos Aires. It is an agricultural region, producing cocoa and bananas, located in the province of Morropon in the Piura region. It is located more than three hours and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For the past five years she has been preparing and selling foods from her small restaurant-bar located in a section of her home. The business is well visited thanks to her good cooking and for the excellent customer service she gives her clients. Her clients are mostly the seasonal workers that come to the region. With the profits she earns she is able to support her family. America wishes to expand her business, wishing to purchase more ingredients to be able to prepare more foods to sell, and improve her profits. In order to reach her goal she accessed a loan through Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. America is a very responsible and very active woman. Her greatest dream is to keep expanding her business until she has a restaurant. Previously she has had loans from Edpyme Alternativa and she has demonstrated timeliness and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
María del Socorro es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Pueblo Libre del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, ella cría pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona o de lo contrario vende su carne por kilos. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, comprando la carne de el pueblo de Tambogrande y vendiendola de manera ambulante en los diversos caseríos de la zona.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que su aves se desarrollen de mejor modo para así poder obtener mas ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre está dispuestas a ayudar a los que la necesitan. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro is a mother, she is 32 years old, and she lives together with her husband and their children in the village of Pueblo Libre in the Tambogrande district. It is an agricultural region located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. It is more than three hours and a half from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. She raises and sells poultry, including turkeys and chickens. She raises them in the rear section of her house, feeding them grains and natural grasses. When they have achieved a certain stage in their development she sells them to the businesses in the region of she sells the meat by the kilogram. Her husband sells beef meat, pork meat and chicken meat. He purchases the meat in the village of Tambogrande and resells in the various villages in the area. Maria wishes to purchase balanced feed to help her poultry grow better and ultimately see better profits. To reach her goal she has decided to request a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. She is a very devoted mother and she is always ready to help anyone in need. Those that know her consider her to be a very calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchased balanced poultry feed.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa Emilia es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el sector San Martín del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola pertenececiente a la provincia de Piura y ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar vendiendo medicinas en una farmacia que forma parte de un consultorio médico de su localidad, esta actividad le ha permitido agenciarse de ingresos permanentes durante dos años, con el dinero fruto de los ahorros que guardaba pudo adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte) con la cual su esposo brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en la ciudad y en los diversos caseríos que la rodean.

Gracias a estas actividades su familia se está consolidando y saliendo adelante poco a poco, lamentablemente el excesivo uso brindado a la mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Rosa Emilia es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre se esfuerza del mejor modo posible para sacar adelante a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una joven responsable y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia is a mother, she is 22 years old and she lives together with her husband and their young son in the San Martin district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural region located in the province and region of Piura. It is more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque. Since she was very young she has sold medicines at a pharmacy, belonging to a medical clinic in her neighborhood. This business has been her source of income for the past two years. With the savings she was able to purchase a motorcycle rickshaw (a motorcycle with an attached cabin to transport goods as well as passengers). Her husband operates this transport service in the city and in the various villages in the region. Thanks to these businesses her family is coming stabilizing and coming about. Unfortunately the constant use of the motorcycle rickshaw has caused some mechanical troubles that need some urgent repairs to maintain a good working order. To this end she has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. Rosa Emilia is a very hard working person and she always does her utmost to provide her family with the best. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider this young woman to be responsible and enterprising.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle rickshaw.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el sector Cruce de Vega del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola dedicada principalmente al cultivo de árboles frutales como mango y limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría ovejas y aves de corral como pavos y gallinas en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Su esposo trabaja en la localidad de Paita a mas de una hora y media del lugar donde vive, con lo que ambos ganan se encargan de solventar los gastos familiares.

Genoveva desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas alimento para mejorar el desarrollo de sus animales, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Genoveva es una mujer tranquila y bastante entregada a su familia, las personas que le conocen le estiman mucho y le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 39 years old, she is married and she lives together with her family in the Cruce de Vega sector of the Tambogrande district. It is an agricultural region dedicated primarily to the cultivation of fruit trees such as mango and lemons. It is located in the province and region of Piura. It is located more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. She raises small farm animals, such as sheep and poultry, including turkeys and chickens. The backyard of her house is where she keeps her livestock. She feeds them grains and natural grasses and when they have reached a certain level in their development she sells them to the merchants that visit the region. With what she and her husband earn they are able to cover the family's expenses. Genoveva wishes to expand her business and wishes to purchase feed to help her livestock grow. In order to reach her goal she has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. Genoveva is a very calm person who is very devoted to her family. Those that know her appreciate her and they consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo ya sus hijos en el sector Cruce de Vega, una zona agrícola dedicada principalmente al cultivo de frutos como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposo en actividades ligadas a la agricultura desde que se casaron. Ella cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde ha sembrado árboles de mango y limón, actualmente estas plantas se encuentran en plena producción y semanalmente se dirige junto a sus hijos a recoger los frutos para luego venderlos a las fabricas del lugar que se encargan de preparar los productos para exportarlos a diversos países del extranjero.

Adicionalmente cría gallos y gallinas en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Su esposo trabaja como dependiente en un fundo del lugar. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de sus respectivas actividades ellos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia de la mejor manera posible.

Margarita desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a sus plantaciones, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles de modo que pueda lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Margarita, 43, is married and lives with her husband and children in Cruce de Vega, an agricultural area known primarily for fruit cultivation, mostly mangoes and lemons. It is part of Piura province, Piura region, located over three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She and her husband have worked in farming-related activities since they got married. She has farmlands where she has planted mango and lemon trees. The plants are currently in their optimal production phase and she and her children harvest fruit weekly to sell to local processing plants that prepare the products for export to various countries abroad. In addition she raises chickens and roosters in her back yard. Her husband is employed as a laborer by a local agricultural estate. Income they both earn from their respective activities is used to provide for the family in the best possible way. Margarita wants to get some fertilizer for crop maintenance. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 500 new sol, loan to reach this objective. Her greatest wish is to continue working to get her family ahead. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a levelheaded, responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for mango and lemon crops.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora María Nicolasa T. A. vive junto a su esposo y sus mayores hijos en su casa propia , la cliente se dedica a la venta de menús a una ladrillera y trabajadores aledaños también prepara potajes de comidas los fines de semana en su domicilio teniendo mas de diez años en está actividad. La solicitante posee experiencia acrediticia por compras de artefactos con buen record de pagos, solicita el crédito para la compra de una cocina que le servirá para su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Nicolasa T. A. lives with her husband and oldest children in her own house. She sells prepared meals to employees of a brick making factory and other nearby workers. She also prepares meals to sell on weekends at home. She has been in this business for over ten years. She has credit history thanks to the purchase of some home appliances that she repaid on time. She is asking for funds to buy a stove that will help her with her food business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stove.

loans.name: José Aurelio

texts.es:
José Aurelio tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en uno de los barrios ubicados en el cercado de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una ciudad bastante comercial, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

José estudió medicina veterinaria, actualmente cuenta con un consultorio en donde ofrece todo tipo de servicios para mascotas, como limpieza, prevención y tratamiento de enfermedades, así como venta de medicinas. El inició sus actividades trabajando para una empresa más grande y poco a poco ahorró dinero para poder instalar su propio consultorio. Su esposa es médico veterinaria también y juntos se encargan de atender su establecimiento.

El cuidado que ponen en la atención y tratamiento de las mascotas de sus clientes han hecho que en los cinco años que lleva funcionando el establecimiento su clientela se haya fidelizado. Actualmente el desea implementar su negocio con la compra de medicinas para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

José desea seguir especializándose en su rama para seguir ayudando a los animales. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien bastante servicial y honrado.
texts.en:
José Aurelio, 31, is married and lives with his wife and minor son in one of the neighborhoods in greater Chiclayo, a very commercial city that is the capital of Lambayeque region. José studied veterinary medicine and has a clinic where he offers all kinds of services for pets like: grooming, disease prevention and treatment as well as the sale of medicine. At the beginning he worked for a large firm until he gradually saved enough money to set up his own clinic. His wife is also a veterinarian and they tend to their business together. The care with which they tend to and treat their customers’ pets has resulted in their securing a regular customer base over the five years they have been in operation. He would like to stock medicines in order to provide still better service. To reach this objective, he has requested his first, 2000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa. José hopes to continue to specialize in his field to continue to help animals. People who know him consider him to be quite helpful and honest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines to stock his veterinary clinic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
José Andrés es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el Caserío Sime, una zona rural pertenececiente al distrito de Pítipo, en la provincia de Ferreñafe, la zona es agrícola y se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de balones de gas y crianza y venta de animales menores. El adquiere balones de gas a una distribuidora y ofrece este producto a los vecinos de la zona. Es el principal abastacedor de lugar por lo que su negocio cuenta con clientela fidelizada. Adicionalmente cría animales menores como aves de corral y cerdos. Cuando estos animales se desarrollan lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona.

José Andrés desea implementar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales con la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado para poder percibir algunos ingresos adicionales que le permitan solventar los gastos familiares, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, ellos le consideran una persona amable y respetable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José Andrés is a 47 year old father who lives with his wife and children in Caserío Sime, a rural area that is part of the District of Pítipo in Ferreñafe Province. This community is also an agricultural area located approximately an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

José sells tanks of natural gas, but he also raises and sells small animals. He acquires tanks of natural gas from a distributor and sells them to neighbors in the area. Since he is the main supplier in the area, his business has a loyal customer base. José also raises small animals such as poultry and pigs. When the animals have developed sufficiently, he offers them for sale to traders who visit the area.

José Andrés wants to continue his business of raising and selling animals, so he plans to buy more of them as well as balanced nutritional feed. This will help him generate additional income to meet the family expenses. To accomplish this goal, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

José is a well-known and respected individual among his neighbors. They consider him to be kind and respectful. With his previous loans from Edpyme Alternativa, he has demonstrated promptness and responsibility when completing his payments.

loans.use: Purchase animals & animal feed

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus menores hijos en el caserío San Antonio, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito agrícola de Mochumí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar diversos granos, adicionalmente cría animales menores como ovejas para comercializarlas a los negociantes de la zona y también se dedica a trabajar como jornalero en los campos de cultivos cercanos, específicamente en cultivos de legumbres y menestras.

Luis desea implementar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales para poder obtener ingresos mas estables, ya que sus otras ocupaciones sólo le brindan ingresos temporales. Por este motivo ha decidido adquirir mas animales y alimento balanceado para lograr su objetivo. Como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luis, al igual que la mayor parte de pobladores del lugar, es una persona bastante trabajadora y con conocimiento de manejo de cultivos. Es alguien que diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para poder sacar adelante a su familia y otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a 38 year old father who lives with his wife and young children in the village of San Antonio, a rural area that is part of the agricultural district of Mochumí. This community is part of Lambayeque Province and located approximately an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Luis has been a farmer for more than fifteen years. He has land on which he grows different types of grain. In addition, he raises small animal such as sheep and sells them to local merchants. Luis also works as a laborer at the nearby farms where he helps with the legume and vegetable crops.

Luis wants to continue his business of raising and selling animals so that he can have a more stable income. His other jobs only provide seasonal income. For this reason, he has decided to acquire more animals and balanced feed to accomplish his goal. Since he does not have sufficient capital to take further action, Luis decided to apply for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Like most of the villagers in the area, Luis is a hard worker who knows how to manage his crops. He does his best every day to succeed on behalf of his family and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase animals & animal feed

loans.name: Julio  Rafael

texts.es: Julio Yépez tiene 28 años y vive con su esposa en San Juan Nepomuceno, desde allí construyeron el sueño de irse a Venezuela a vivir y a trabajar a buscar un mejor futuro; fue así como iniciaron con una tienda en el vecino país, pero gradualmente la situación de allí se puso difícil y decidieron buscar la forma de salir adelante, por eso se regresaron a su pueblo natal e iniciaron el negocio de vender  víveres  traídos  desde Venezuela y así mismo enviaban  artesanía desde San Juan Nepomuceno, a Venezuela  para comercializarla. En la actualidad solicitan su primer credikiva, el cual invertirán en la compra de víveres, como arroz, leche en polvo, aceite, calzado, bolsos y billeteras, con este financiamiento tendrán un capital de trabajo disponible para conseguir a un buen precio los artículos que ellos venden y no tener que traerlos desde el país vecino.  Su sueño es ahora tener un local bien amplio y convertirlo en un depósito de estas mercancías para venderla al por mayor en tiendas y a distribuidores del municipio y de otros ubicados a su alrededor. Con su negocio Julio y su esposa están construyendo el futuro de su familia para cuando vengan los hijos tener todas los condiciones que la educación y la crianza ameritan
texts.en:
Julio Yépez is 28 years old and lives with his wife in San Juan Nepomuceno. From there they built their dream of traveling to Venezuela so that they can live, work, and seek a better future. They opened a store in the neighboring country, but gradually the situation there became difficult and they decided to find a way to move forward. Julio and his wife returned to their hometown and started a business selling provisions brought over from Venezuela as well as buying handicrafts from San Juan Nepomuceno to sell in Venezuela.

Julio is currently requesting his first Kiva loan which will be used to buy provisions such as rice, powdered milk, and oil as well as shoes, purses, and wallets. This funding will provide available operating capital to continue receiving low prices for the goods he sells without having to bring them over from Venezuela. His dream is to have a larger store and convert it into a warehouse where he can sell merchandise in bulk to stores, local distributors, and other entities in the surrounding areas.

With this business, Julio and his wife are able to build a future for their family so that when they are ready to have children, they can provide all the conditions to raise and educate them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, powdered milk, oil, shoes, purses, and wallets

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es: Esta  foto fue tomada en el negocio D. la Sra. Araceli Romana N. D. J. la cual es tesorera del grupo “Rayito D. Luna” que está ubicado en  Tehuacán, Puebla en México. En la foto podemos apreciar el lugar donD. planea poner  salón D. belleza, así como el  material que utiliza para hacer cortes D. cabello y peinados, ella tiene 10 años dedicándose a esta actividad. Sus clientes siempre quedan contentos porque les gusta como les corta el cabello, la señora Araceli   se siente contenta con su  préstamo ya que le agrada la idea D. que alguien confíe en ella  y sus compañeras. La tesorera tiene 37 años, solo tuvo la oportunidad D. cursar la secundaria, pero eso no le impidió salir adelante, es madre D. 3 hijos, 1 mujer y dos varones. Con el crédito ella piensa  remodelar y comprar más cosas para su salón D. belleza, además piensa tomar otro curso D. cultura D. belleza para actualizarse en los peinados y cortes D. cabello, para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder captar a más gente, su prioridad es apoyar a sus hijos para que ellos sigan estudiando y tengan una mejor oportunidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the business of Sra. Araceli Romana N. D. J., who is the group treasurer of “Rayito D. Luna” (Little Moon Ray) that is located in Tehuacán, Puebla in Mexico. As indicated by the photo, the place where she works is a beauty salon that has the equipment to proviD. haircuts and styling services. Araceli has been in business for ten years and her customers like the way she cuts their hair. She is pleased to have her loan and likes the idea of having someone who trusts her and her fellow group members.

Araceli is 37 years old and only had the opportunity to finish high school. However, this has not stopped her from moving forward. She is the mother of three children, one daughter and two sons. Her loan will be used to remodel her beauty salon and buy more equipment. She also plans to take another course in the culture of beauty so that she can keep up with the latest hairstyles and haircuts. This will help her proviD. the best service and attract more customers. Her priority is to support her children so that they can continue their education and have the best opportunity in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Martha Lidia V. tiene 54 años de edad, y junto a su esposo y a su hijo de 12 años reside en Barrio Belén en la Ciudad de Juticalpa. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ser calzado, ropa, lociones, cosméticos y otros productos de uso personal. Inició este negocio porque los ingresos de su esposo eran pocos y para ayudarlo decidió destinar una parte de su casa para instalar una pequeña tienda y así tener un ingreso extra que le permitiera llevar parte del sustento para la familia. Una de las desventajas que enfrenta es que su negocio está ubicado enfrente de una calle de tierra y dado a que el clima es muy caliente debe mantener la puerta de la tienda abierta y la mercadería se le llena de polvo. Martha solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de más y variados productos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá mantener su tienda bien surtida e incrementar sus ventas y así llevar el sustento a su hogar. Su meta es hacerle mejoras a su local para que el producto exhibido no se le dañe. Martha ha sido cliente de FAMA por tres ciclos y su comportamiento de pago es muy bueno, cabe mencionar que por su puntualidad ha sido premiada como una de las mejores clientas de la institución.
texts.en:
Martha Lidia V. is 54 years old and lives with her husband and twelve year old son in the neighborhood of Belén in the city of Juticalpa. She sells merchandise such as shoes, clothing, lotions, cosmetics, and other personal products. Martha started this business because her husband’s income is low, so she designated a section of her house for establishing a small store where she can earn extra income to support her family. One of the disadvantages that she faces is that her business is located along a dirt road. When the weather gets hot she must keep the door open, which causes her merchandise to be covered in dust.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise of various kinds. The support she is receiving through this loan will help her keep her store well-stocked and increase her sales, thereby allowing her to support her household. Her goal is to make improvements to her store so that she can display her products in a way to prevent them from getting damaged. Martha has been a client of FAMA OPDF for three loan cycles and possesses a very good payment history. It should be mentioned that her promptness has resulted in her being recognized as one of the best clients of FAMA OPDF.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Ruby Emperatriz

texts.es:
Ruby Páez de San Jacinto Bolívar es una gran artesana que sabe cómo  generar ingresos trabajando en varias actividades y es que esto lo hace desde muy joven; primero inició con una tienda, producto de su experiencia como empleada de un almacén, pero los clientes querían todo a crédito y no recuperaba el dinero de inmediato como lo amerita este negocio;  luego decidió vender mercancía a clientes que estaban empleados y le fue muy bien y desde allí adicionó también lo que más le gusta hacer y que es parte de su naturaleza:   tejer  mochilas y hamacas y al mismo tiempo empezó también su negocio de preparar  almuerzos corrientes, porque es una experta en comidas,  mientras simultáneamente continua con la venta de calzado y ropa que es una necesidad permanente de sus clientes y hasta le ha agregado la comercialización de artículos para el hogar. El credikiva es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con sus anteriores financiamientos ha logrado aumentar sus ingresos y con ello que sus hijos estudien, porque tiene  como su sueño principal trabajar persistentemente hasta que terminen en la Universidad, pues ellos son muy estudiosos y también sueñan con ser profesionales; también con sus crèditos ha logrado adquirir herramientas y enseres para adecuar su negocio de alimentos y ampliar y diversificar la oferta de productos, como hasta ahora lo ha hecho. Con este financiamiento comprarà hilaza, pita y otros insumos para elaborar mochilas encargadas e insumos para elaborar comidas como arroz aceite, sal y carnes en mayor volumen, asi como mercancias variadas.
El  mayor desafío de Ruby  es elegir clientes responsables cuando le compran a crédito, pero cada día aprende más y gradualmente asume riesgos controlados, como solo venderle a quienes trabajan y son recomendados de sus mejores clientes. Otro  de sus desafíos es educar ella sola a sus hijos después de la separación de su esposo, pero da gracias a Dios porque sus esfuerzos no resultan infructuosos pues sus hijos, son muy conscientes de sus esfuerzos y están aprovechando las posibilidades que ella está construyendo.
texts.en:
Ruby Páez is a talented artisan from San Jacinto Bolívar who knows how to generate income by working at various activities from a young age. At first she opened a store, utilizing the experience she gained while working at a retail business. However, all of her customers requested credit, so she was not able to collect payments in a timely fashion as required by her business. She then decided to sell merchandise to customers who were employed and did very well. From there she also chose to pursue the activity she enjoys the most and comes to her naturally – making woven purses and hammocks. At the same time, Ruby started another business preparing lunches to go because she is a food expert. She continued to sell clothing and shoes as a necessity because she had established customers and later on added household goods to the inventory of products she offered.

This Kiva loan is the third time she has requested financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With her previous loans, Ruby was able to increase her earnings and pay for her children’s schooling because her greatest dream is to see them work tirelessly until they can finish university. Her children are very studious and also dream of becoming professionals. In addition, her loans helped her to acquire tools and equipment to retrofit her food business so that she could expand and diversify her product offering which she has already achieved. With this loan she plans to buy thread and natural fibers for making purses for which she has received orders. In addition, she will buy ingredients such as rice, oil, salt, and meat in large volume, as well as a variety of other merchandise.

Ruby’s biggest challenge is selecting customers who are responsible when purchasing on credit. Every day she is learning more and gradually controlling the amount of risk she takes by only selling to individuals who are working or have been recommended by her best customers. Another challenge she faces is paying for her children’s education by herself since she has separated from her husband. Thanks to God, her efforts have not been fruitless because her children are very aware of her hard work and are taking advantage of the opportunities she has created for them.

loans.use: Purchase thread and natural fibers for making purses; ingredients for her food business; and a variety of merchandise for her retail business

Lysel E. is from the village of Mangandingay Cabarroguis Quirino. She is 36 years old. Lysel is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lysel E..

Lysel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lysel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice. Lysel has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lysel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lysel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lysel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty Z. vive en la ciudad de Cartagena en el departamento de Bolívar, con su cónyuge y  2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 15 años; desde el año 2007 regresó a Colombia procedente de Venezuela sin ningún dinero y contando solo con el patrimonio que había logrado obtener, mediante su trabajo durante mucho tiempo: su casa. Así fue como iniciaron desde cero, pues su esposo de oficio albañil, había perdido contacto con los constructores y por eso iniciaron con una venta de boli, bebida refrescante y congelada de frutas naturales y deditos de queso en la puerta de un colegio muy cercano a su casa,  para lograr algo de efectivo corriente y sostener su familia. Mientras su esposo empezaba a trabajar, ella  fue poco a y  anotaba en su libreta los pedidos  y salía a comprar lo que sus clientes necesitan, acordando con ellos un plazo para pagar la totalidad de la mercancía. Gradualmente y con mucho juicio logró comprar una vitrina, lo cual le dio mayor orden a su negocio y de esa manera vendía mas pues se veía la mercancía exhibida. De esta manera  con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo disciplinado, fue sacando adelante los estudios de sus hijos y así espera cumplir su sueño de verlos convertidos en unos profesionales.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará ropa, calzado cosmético que es lo que más se vende a final del año y desde ya tiene encargados. Su sueño es convertir su negocio en una gran miscelánea,  donde tenga de todo un poco de lo que sus clientes requieran, hasta lograr convertirla en un almacén muy reconocido. Su mayor desafío es la construcción de su capital de trabajo día a día y por eso requiere estos financiamientos que la ayudan a este propósito.
texts.en:
Betty Z. lives in the city of Cartagena, Department of Bolívar, with her husband and two children (ages 12 and 15). In 2007 she returned to Colombia with no money after living in Venezuela. The only asset that she had was the house she acquired as a result of working for such a long time. At that point, Betty decided to start from scratch. Her husband worked as a mason, but he had lost touch with all of his contacts in the construction business. For this reason, she started a business selling frozen treats, soft drinks, frozen fruits, and cheese snacks at the entrance of a school near her home. This allowed her to earn some money to support her family. As her husband started to find work, she began accepting orders and traveling to buy the items that her customers needed. In return, her customers would pay for all of their merchandise by a specified deadline. Gradually and judiciously, Betty was able to buy a display case for organizing her business and exhibiting her merchandise. With great effort and discipline in her work, she was able to move her children forward with their education. Betty hopes to fulfill her dream of seeing her children become professionals.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Betty will use the proceeds to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics since she sells more these products at the end of year and has already received orders for these items. Her dream is to convert her business to a large variety store where she can offer a little bit of everything that her customers need until her establishment becomes well-known. Her greatest challenge is to build up her operating capital every day, so the loans will help her in this regard.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics

To make a living, Margarita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. 

Margarita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise and additional feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and buy additional feed

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando G. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 46 years old. Armando is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Armando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Armando is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Armando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chout

texts.en: Chout S., 28, makes and sells brooms with his wife in the local market of his Takeo province. He started this business in2005 and is able to make about US$3 of profit a day. The couple have one child who still being supported at home. Since Chout S. spends a lot on transportation, he would like to take out a loan of US$400 to purchase a motorbike for his transportation needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Oam

texts.en: Oam P., 69, is married and lives with one of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by one child who works in a garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Oam P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a motorbike.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: Wilfreda S., from the town of Trinidad, is 61 years old, married to a fisherman and has a 38-year-old child. To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan  from CEVI, Wilfreda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to repair her fishing boat and buy fishnets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To repair fishing boat and buy fishnets

loans.name: Mi

texts.en:
Mi P., 61, who is married and lives with her three children in Takeo Province, is a farmer earning less than US$1 each day, while her husband sells mats and earns US$2 each day. This couple is also supported by three children working in the garment factory.

The weather conditions have made farming in Cambodia difficult this past year, and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have resulted in a stressful economic year for many Cambodians, including Mi P.. In light of these conditions, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer for farming and a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a motorbike.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy D. G., from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya, is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be Daisy's fifth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Pay

texts.en: Pay Sreyleang, 42, is a professional tailor making US$1 each day in Takeo Province. Her husband, pictured here, makes approximately US$2.50 daily working in construction. Pay is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband so that he can operate a moto-taxi whenever he is free from construction duties.

loans.use: To purchase and operate a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
Germana P., photographed at her farm with one of her grandchildren, is from the town of Trinidad. She is 66 years old. Germana is married and has seven children. Her eldest child is now 42 years old and the youngest is 25. Germana is a rice farmer and has been planting and harvesting rice since she was in her 20s. She says she continues to spend time tilling her farm because she wants to help provide for her children and grandchildren.

Germana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Germana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs and pay for the rent of the tractor she uses. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra E. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 57 years old. Silvestra is married and has two children aged 28 and 26. To make a living, Silvestra owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She wishes for her business to last and sustain her family's income.

Silvestra joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silvestra has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Silvestra is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
Nancy M. es una mujer  de 50 años que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y 4 hijos en las edades de 23 a 28 años. Nancy se dedica a dos actividades productivas al mismo tiempo, por un lado confecciona vestidos en su pequeño taller de modistería y por otro lado mantiene en sus manos un catálogo para ofrecer los productos de cosméticos que también vende.
Su actividad de confecciones la realiza en el macro proyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, pues allí tiene muchos compradores,  pero también  tiene clientes en otros barrios donde desarrolla su actividad comercial y la promociona  en los alrededores del   barrio  Nelson Mandela, donde mucha gente la conoce.
Nancy ha recibido necesarias dos creditos de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha logrado adicionar nuevos clientes y adecuar su infraestructura con maquinarias que necesitaba para el desarrollo de su actividad y tambien ha logrado el fortalecimiento de sus tareas de mercadeo de productos mediante guías especializadas, que le representa otro ingreso importante para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Nancy es una persona muy optimista y su sueño está enfocado en hacer crecer su negocio y para ello pone todo su empeño porque quiere algún día verlo  convertido   en una pequeña empresa. Con su credikiva comprará materiales de confección como telas e insumos como hilos y otra parte la invertirá en cosméticos que sus clientes le han solicitado, siguiendo con este orden ella esta segura que algun dia lo lograra.
texts.en:
Nancy M. is a 50 year old woman who lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and four children who are between the ages of 23 and 28. She engages in two productive business activities at the same time. On one hand, she makes clothing in her small tailoring shop. On the other hand, she maintains a catalog from which she offers cosmetics for sale.

Her sewing business is conducted in the city of Bicentenario where she has many buyers. She also has customers in other neighborhoods where the commercial activity is developing. Nancy also markets her business in the areas around the Nelson Mandela neighborhood where she knows many people.

Nancy has already taken out two loans with Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, which she needed to attract new customers and equip her business with the machines that would help her develop. In addition, she strengthened her retail business by offering products from specialty catalogs since this venture represents an important source of income for supporting her household.

Nancy is an optimistic person who is focused on growing her business. Therefore, she works hard so that she can see it develop into a small enterprise. Her Kiva loan will be used to buy sewing materials and supplies such as fabrics and thread. Part of the loan will be invested in cosmetics that her customers have ordered. Nancy continues to press forward because she is confident that someday she will achieve what she set out to do.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and thread for her sewing business; invest in cosmetics that her customers have ordered

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum S., 57, is married with three children living at home in the Takeo province.

She works in a grocery store, typically making US$2 each day and her husband raises pigs and grows rice. Her husband typically makes about US$1 each day as a pig farmer. 

Oum S. would like a loan of US$500 to purchase more pigs and increase the stock of her grocery items.

loans.use: To raise pigs and buy grocery items.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mang S., 37, makes and sells pig banks at the local market of her Takeo province. She typically makes US$2 of profit every day, while her husband works in construction and earns US$2 per day. 

This couple has five children, two are garment factory workers and three are in school. Mang S. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to make new investment. She will build a small coffee shop to sell coffee.

loans.use: To open a coffee shop.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas M., 41, is a professional silk weaver, making US$2 of profit every day. She is married and has four young children living at home to support. 

Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he is able to make US$2 of profit a day as well. 

Meas M. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia B. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Lucrecia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lucrecia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lucrecia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon P., 55, lives in the Takeo province. She is married with two young children living at home. 

She is a recycler, typically making US$10 each day. Her husband is a horse cart driver who typically makes about US$5 each day. 

Suon P. would like a loan of US$750 to purchase a motorbike to transport recycling items.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her recycling business

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
Soum S., 38, is a widow with two children. They all live in the Takeo province. 

She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 per day. She also receives support from one of her children, who works in a garment factory. 

Soum S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in a small city in Pakistan called Kasur, which is famous for its leather industry. She lives in the area of Kullay-wala with her husband and 4 children. Her first two children are enrolled in a local school; the other two are too young to attend school. 

Her husband, M. T., has a dairy business. Currently, he has two buffalos at his home and he gets milk from them to sell. His buffalos give him almost 16-20 kg of milk, which he sells to different milk shops to earn income for the family.   

Nasreen also works. She weaves carpets at her home. The carpets are in high demand in larger cities; people love to buy the handmade carpets to decorate their homes. She is also a very caring mother and a wife. She manages her household well and takes care of her children.  

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo to increase the milk production of his business.  

Nasreen is very confident of her family’s bright future. She has trust in her husband that he will bring positive changes to his business by utilizing the loan in a proper way. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. With her previous loans, she has proved herself a responsible client who always paid installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang S., 29, lives in the Takeo province. She is married and has three young children living at home. 

She works in a grocery store, typically making US$15 in revenue each day. Her husband works collecting recycling items; he typically makes about US$5 each day. 

Leang S. would like a loan of US$500 to increase her stock of grocery products.

loans.use: To increase her stock of grocery products

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Hoy R., 41, lives in the Takeo province. She is married and has three children living at home. 

She is a garment factory worker, typically making US$3 each day. Her husband works collecting recycling items; he typically makes about US$15 in revenue each day. 

Hoy R. would like a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work
